pros: Lifespace is looking toward the future and working toward the goal of being "best in class" Leadership is diverse, some from senior living and some from other industries, helping to bring "out of the box" ideas to help us achieve our company goal. Pay is very competitive Good comprehensive benefits package
cons: None that I can think of at this time.

review_title: Management are the biggest manipulators and fakest people
job_title: Maintenance Technician in West Des Moines, IA
pros: Your coworkers will be some of the smartest, dedicated, hard working people you will ever meet.
cons: Just a poorly managed and run company from top to bottom. Management are the biggest manipulators and fakest people I've ever met. Some of the employees are really good, but the rot is so high up that even the good ones don't have the chances to shine and thrive that they deserve. It's just been a poorly run company for a long time, and continues to be to this day. It makes me physically sick to think of what they're doing to people, and what they'll continue to do to people.

pros: Nice building, free juice. 2 days off a week.
cons: Not getting paid on time or correctly staff are always complaining about this issue That is a regular occurrence at this company. Very disorganized ,people quit frequently. Covid is still a issue which they are not very concerned about. No hand sanitizer or enough gloves. This company is just another big corporation trying to squeeze every profitable penny they can at the risk of staff and residents. Was lied to more than was told the truth. Do not count on the sign on bonus if your foolish enough to apply you will never receive it. Over time shift differentials are paid out wrong but they get away with it. Half the staff didn't get their Christmas and New Years over time last pay day. They lie and tell you they will pay double time on the holidays but you will never get it. Same with the extra pay for working on weekends....that is a lie too. If you enjoy being treated badly doing back breaking work for poverty wages then this is your dream job.

pros: it’s a great community. you’re able to make connections and build relationships. a fun and active environment.
cons: i don’t really have anything bad to say rn, tbh.

review_title: Headline: Uninspiring, depressing, and ultimately a soon to be dissolved entity
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in West Des Moines, IA
pros: People were great, and the company was widely respected. However, that respect will certainly wear off given the leadership's attitude and general lack of understanding of the company.
cons: You will want to leave this company in just 3 months. Employee satisfaction went from 100 - 0 real quick. Attrition rates were through the roof. You will do work that requires no brainpower, just monotonous mindless activity. People come, they realize it was all rhetoric and they leave, and the cycle continues. Uninspiring, depressing, and ultimately a soon to be dissolved entity.

job_title: Regional Director of Human Resources in Chicago, IL
pros: I have worked at Lifespace for almost 6 years and I love it. Lifespace is a company that embodies everything you would hope for as a great place to work. They have a noble mission to provide exceptional care for our residents. Every team member plays a key part in this. The newer senior leadership team has truly adopted the servant leadership mentality and often leads meetings with how can we help. While there is a lot of work to do, it is great to have a team to lean on, and I can honestly say I have fun doing my job. The culture and values are created in a way that not only impacts the work environment, but challenges us to be a better person both at work and outside of work.
cons: Workload seems high right now and some of that is driven by the business world in general. We are also making huge leaps to implement better systems that will enable us to perform even better. The hard work put in today will be very rewarding in the near future.

review_title: Good place to start a career
pros: Met some amazing co-workers during my tenure.
cons: Sometimes the units can be short-staffed.

review_title: At the forefront of transforming the aging experience
pros: From the first moment of the interview process to the day to day work as a team member, I have felt the energy that senior leadership has in transforming the aging experience and making Lifespace Communities the maverick in senior living. With all of the changes in the world over the last two years, Lifespace is focused on building a culture where all team members can make an impact and can be a contributor to the future. I've never been in an organization until Lifespace where there is truly no politics - everyone is here to make an impact in the lives of our residents. It's so refreshing!
cons: As with all organizations out there right now, there is more turnover than is ideal so it's causing a little extra anxiety on how we are going to get everything done.

pros: The good thing about working at lifespace was the schedule they always worked with you and it was only weekdays no weekends. They have great benefits.
cons: No one seemed happy working there. Over work you

job_title: Culinary Server in Wekiwa Springs, FL
pros:
-Less stressful than traditional restaurant jobs
-Competitive pay for an entry-level position
-Fun work environment with a strong emphasis on forming relationships with customers
cons: -Workers are generally high school kids, which could be a pro or a con depending upon your age.

review_title: LIfespace No Longer the Leader of the Pack
pros:
- Dedicated Team Members. 
- Residents are the reason you come to work each day.
- So much potential for residents and team members.
cons:
- Morale in communities both residents and team members at an all-time low. 
- Sales Directors through the enterprise are quitting because a lack of direction and support, filling them with people with little or no experience in CCRC. This is not a hotel; it is someone's home. 
- Lifespace's reputation is the worst it has been in years. They have lost site of their own mission. Residents have said they feel stuck or they would leave. 
- The community I work in, core management over promises and under delivers on a daily basis. This highly frustrates the residents and team members. 
- Residents are unhappy. 
- Things that residents took pride in like the landscaping and culinary is an embarrassment. Core management often blaming home office for the problems.
- Seldom does Lifespace promote within. Little to no room for advancement. 
- Team members that have longevity with the company used to be the norm...now it is rare. 
- It seems communities are now charging residents for every little thing in addition to their monthly service fee. There is no balance.

job_title: Global Human Resources Data Specialist in West Des Moines, IA
pros:
Family oriented, flexible work schedule, access to great benefits, good pay, good communication, the acknowledge successes all the time, they also allow for times for co-workers to have time to get to know one another. 

personally I have tried to get a couple of my friends to hire on, it is a great place to work
cons: training for the most part is good, there are some instances where it can be a figure it out situation, but that can be at any place of employment

pros: The work can be rewarding.
cons:
For the past eight years Lifespace has been caught up in a time warp of missteps. The board brings in new leadership and when that leadership fails they try to fix it by overcorrecting.

The last couple rounds of leadership have had one major misstep in common. They overpromise their customers and future customers a high level of hospitality style service and when they cannot deliver on those promises, the blame trickles down to the unit level leadership. Then they turnover staff, rinse and repeat. The approach needs to change. 

It's quite sad and reflects poorly on leadership's ability to comprehend what it takes to provide services to high end CCRC customers. We are not high end hotels, the pay isn't the same and for the most part the customers are just looking for consistency. 

Additionally, if you want to play in the "five-star" sandbox you must pay competitive to that market and for goodness sake, rethink recruiting. What worked 20 years ago doesn't work anymore.

review_title: The Culture is Second to None!
pros: The culture is built on clear values that drive a positive environment where team members can thrive. This is truly the best place that I have ever worked. Everyone is focused on providing a quality experience for our team members and our residents. It's a great place to be!
cons: I'm new and all has been positive so far. I have no concerns or cons to share.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Lombard, IL
pros: Wonderful residents. Fun team members also
cons: Poorly run. Home office and new director are making it hard to stay

pros: Great residents, great coworkers and lots of community togetherness
cons: Bad management, unfair treatment, over worked, will lie to get people fired, take advantage of residents money

review_title: Ok. Too many "managers" who are nurses and don't help out with short staffing. They sit in their offices.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN), Long-Term Care in Bloomington, MN
pros: Co-workers  over worked while still keeping  a smile on their face!
cons: Too many chiefs. Unnecessarily! They don't get out of their tiny offices to mingle with the staff and residents.

pros: Will work with your schedule
cons: Very unorganized. Treat you like a slave. Careless of any personal things that might stop you from coming in. Administration will talk to you as you are a child.

review_title: Tight knit "club" per opinion. Try to be likeable and favored.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Bloomington, MN

job_title: Cerfied Nursing Assistant in Urbandale, IA
pros: need improvement and values to the staff members
cons: Need for improvement and assistance

pros: Helpful coworkers who teach you what to do, and a competent management that was attentive to worker needs.
cons: Repetitive, but that's the nature of the work.

pros: So far the benefits are good, but that will only continue as long as you are employed by Lifespace or until they need the money to continue to grow the Home Office. (see below) The residents and fellow team members are great to work with.
cons: Since the new CEO started,  the home office has increased staffing by 117%. That money has to come from somewhere. All bonus's below director have been eliminated and for director they are based on unrealistic goals so basically no more bonus's. Not earth shattering for most but for those in marketing it is like a 25-50% cut in pay. Home Office response. We can do what we like, if it no longer works for you you are free to leave. Can the loss of other benefits be far behind? They are also planning on contracting out a lot of service areas over the next few years; dietary; security; housekeeping; grounds; fitness. More consistency and less hassle with fewer employees to manage and a set budget.  A win-win for Home Office but avoid taking a job in any of these areas in the next year because it might go away when the contract companies come in. Will notice be given? Unlikely.  After all it is just business and if you don't like it......

job_title: Culinary Server in Des Moines, IA
pros: Good pay for a first experience job. The company culture is inclusive, the other team members and residents are very kind. Management does a good job of scheduling and is flexible with your needs.
cons: I honestly down''t see any downsides to working here, but these opinions are my own.

pros: Large department lots of support
cons: Corporate seems more concerned with $$

pros: Very understanding, great training, and pretty good pay to start off
cons: Just some of the employees

review_title: Lifespace is doing all the right things
pros: Lifespace Communities, under the very capable leadership of its executive team, is investing "time and treasure" in all aspects of the company. As a lifecare company, their mission is clearly stated, but they go one step further and have invested in making it part of the daily culture.   I came to Lifespace in 2015 from another lifecare company, and have been in "shock and awe" of the investment being made not only in the communities they serve, but in their human resources that serve their resident population.  The initial on boarding, a two day program, sets the tone for the expectation as a team member of this organization. Continued, consistent training throughout your tenure with the company (not just the initial on boarding) is just one example of the investment being made in each team member.     My personal experience has been excellent, and I would encourage anyone who is interested in a company that is forward thinking, innovative and committed to being a leader in senior care, to apply for a position.
cons: I do not have any comments to make, as my experience as been positive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: A wonderful new culture program being rolled out to all communities that sounds great. The problem is that upper management talk the talk but do NOT walk the walk. Their new culture program should be called project "smoke and mirrors."
cons: Policies and actions of the corporate office do not support new culture program. They have a communication department that monitors Glassdoor and posts positive feedback every time someone writes something negative. Even their recruiter is having to write positive things about the company.  Next, they will have their Vice Presidents and Executive Directors writing positive reviews.  I would not put it past upper management to make it mandatory.

pros: Unique and forward thinking culture progam.  Would be amazing if the followed what the say.  Super fancy new corporate office with all the bells & whistles including private bathroom for CEO.
cons:
Repeatedly change policy & practice with out warning or consulting those who do the actual work.  New culture program created more resentment & dissatisfaction than it solves.  Tell us how bad multi-tasking is for your brain, cares, & accuracy.  Still expect you to multi-task.  Tells you to "own every problem".  Then punishes those who try to.  Says residents and employees are important then allowes corporate managers to mock & make fun of them and how "stupid" they are. 
Tells you to be sympathetic & understanding.  Then when you get outsourced ypu are told to act happy & get over it less than 24 hours later.

Not that any of that will matter for long since the goal seems to be to outsource everyone so vp's & upper management can go golfing & buy fancy pictures & go clubbing without having to deal with actual employee's.

review_title: Going down the tubes!  Poor corporate leadership.
job_title: Executive Director in Delray Beach, FL
pros: Serving the residents and serving the employees.  The culture is created at the community and preserved by the staff and resident relationships.
cons: Navigating the horrible corporate culture!  This company is going down the tubes and it won't belong before the Board of Directors intervenes.

pros: The  non-exempt people are awesome to work with!
cons: From the CEO down to Executive directors is another story. No Direction!!  Approvals from corporate office take way too long and lay on desks for no apparent reason. Makes dept. directors struggle with the day to day operation and respect of residents.   Bad decisions from Directors have lost a lot of good people, self included. Creation of a hostile workplace by management got me!

pros: The residents were a delight to work with. They were always happy to receive any help we could give them. The hourly employees are also terrific to work with.
cons: Some of the local managers are unresponsive and unhelpful. I think this is because corporate puts so much pressure on them, and treats them so badly that they in turn treat their employees badly. Moral is incredibly low.

pros: The management is very organized. The meals are included during work hours on lunch or dinner breaks. All of the staff are very friendly.
cons: Not many benefits for employees who are part time. Because there is a limited number of employees, finding someone to cover a shift can be difficult.

job_title: Spiritual Life Director in Delray Beach, FL
pros: Coworkers were supportive, very friendly, and willing to help you succeed as a team. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Able to work independently without micromanaging from management. They valued this position.
cons: Didn't have a full-time position for this job

pros:
Working for the wonderful residents which Lifespace seems to have forgotten are the customers and their source of income. 

Working with great coworkers which Lifespace has forgotten are the gears that makes everything work.

There are a lot of great programs Lifespace have but don't work because behind the scene Lifespace have ruined everything. Both residents and employees are too upset and angry for any of it to work.

Lifespace will most likely outsource you to another company that often pay better. Now think about that for a minute. You bring in a company to do things cheaper that pay their own employees better? That right there is a huge hint on what is wrong.

Profiting off of a non-profit organization.
cons:
15 years ago there was a 2 year waiting list for the Village on the Green, one of Lifespace's communities. That is how popular and wonderful the place was. Now there are 35 empty apartments out of 250. That is the worse it has ever been and the trend indicates it will only get worse. This means loss of income which in turn results in more services being cut which in turn upsets the customers who move out or bad mouth the company to their friends who should be potential customers. The typical strategy when you have a product that doesn't sell is to lower the price. Lifespace does the opposite and raises prices which causes more customers to move out.

The grounds crew, the security staff, and dietary management have all been outsourced within the last year. Hours for maintenance, housekeeping and dietary have been cut within the last month. The company calls these "cost cutting initiatives". It actually is a sign of a desperate company about to fail.

review_title: Can't get much worse??? Or can it?
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: The Residents are the most amazing people and they are loyal they love their team members and a few team members that remain are what is good that's all
cons: Blatant favoritism, verbally and mentally abusive environment. it is who you know at "Corporate " and not your qualifications and what you are capabilities. Executive Director is on drugs or acts like it, awful directors unqualified some without degrees and some are alcoholics everyone looks the other way - do as I say not as I do I suppose, don't get involved just do your job yeah that works. home office what a joke these people are unintelligent sinking us like the titanic, increased by 117% lining their pockets while no raises for us, laughing down at the Communities, spa days and lobster dinners while residents lose services great use of residents $. Go talk to HR yeah right they just go tell on you and you get in trouble. They treat team members "beneath" them like dog crap. Refuse to allow vacation earned vacation at that!! yet in same breath "promote a balanced work/home life" take time off you'll pay for it after with a Smerk on their face. Then they go take time off right after what a great feeling. expect to squeeze more out of people using scare tactics which results into the opposite - a horrible environment, don't you have common sense, promote a happy and healthy thriving environment and your "people" will produce and go above the norm. No feeling of job security quite the opposite. No trust in this company just stepping on people and reality tv drama shenanigans. Keep your head down there worker and get back to work. Embarrassed to work 4 such a despicable company. All about $$$ now. HO won't be happy until everyone leaves but then who will be in the communities. The residents and team members suffer daily and are mad as heck. Get told one thing one day then something opposite the next day and it's your fault you are confused! Massive confusion and no structure too much OCD control we are not children. When will the BOD step in and eliminate CEO and HO. It will be too late. Promote from within stop bringing on your prior buddies, this is real life maybe the members from within you already know will say no so you bring in the poor ignorant new people- they'll find out they always do. Only been here a few months and worst experience ever. Be human care about people - enough is enough. How many amazing people have to exit? Deaf ear every . "Everyone is replaceable" is this the new motto how is that living LIFESPACE?

pros: Great coworkers and residents redevelopment happening
cons: In 2015 the Florida communities were doing great  then some brilliant executive decision raised the prices  and  disrespected many staff members now all but one community is struggling    how does that happen

pros: Insurance,nothing else really.  I have to write a long sentence so i can flip the next page. Somehow
cons: Minimum wage pay. Leaders/supervisors/directors never happy with what you do. Never is enough. I will refer only non english speaker so at least they can survive and endure all the craziness that they offer.

pros: The residents are wonderful. Home office can be helpful
cons: There is definite favoritism and a culture of intimidation. New employees are treated horrendously by "veteran" employees.  Upper management are unprofessional. Any concerns addressed to HR are mocked and ignored.  It is made very clear that upper management are "protected," no matter what. It is definitely more about who you know than what you know.

pros: Helpful coworkers who teach you what to do, and a competent management that was attentive to worker needs.

pros: So far the benefits are good, but that will only continue as long as you are employed by Lifespace or until they need the money to continue to grow the Home Office. (see below) The residents and fellow team members are great to work with.
cons: Since the new CEO started,  the home office has increased staffing by 117%. That money has to come from somewhere. All bonus's below director have been eliminated and for director they are based on unrealistic goals so basically no more bonus's. Not earth shattering for most but for those in marketing it is like a 25-50% cut in pay. Home Office response. We can do what we like, if it no longer works for you you are free to leave. Can the loss of other benefits be far behind? They are also planning on contracting out a lot of service areas over the next few years; dietary; security; housekeeping; grounds; fitness. More consistency and less hassle with fewer employees to manage and a set budget.  A win-win for Home Office but avoid taking a job in any of these areas in the next year because it might go away when the contract companies come in. Will notice be given? Unlikely.  After all it is just business and if you don't like it......

cons: I honestly down''t see any downsides to working here, but these opinions are my own.

pros: Large department lots of support
cons: Corporate seems more concerned with $$

pros: Very understanding, great training, and pretty good pay to start off
cons: Just some of the employees

review_title: Lifespace is doing all the right things
pros: Lifespace Communities, under the very capable leadership of its executive team, is investing "time and treasure" in all aspects of the company. As a lifecare company, their mission is clearly stated, but they go one step further and have invested in making it part of the daily culture.   I came to Lifespace in 2015 from another lifecare company, and have been in "shock and awe" of the investment being made not only in the communities they serve, but in their human resources that serve their resident population.  The initial on boarding, a two day program, sets the tone for the expectation as a team member of this organization. Continued, consistent training throughout your tenure with the company (not just the initial on boarding) is just one example of the investment being made in each team member.     My personal experience has been excellent, and I would encourage anyone who is interested in a company that is forward thinking, innovative and committed to being a leader in senior care, to apply for a position.
cons: I do not have any comments to make, as my experience as been positive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: A wonderful new culture program being rolled out to all communities that sounds great. The problem is that upper management talk the talk but do NOT walk the walk. Their new culture program should be called project "smoke and mirrors."
cons: Policies and actions of the corporate office do not support new culture program. They have a communication department that monitors Glassdoor and posts positive feedback every time someone writes something negative. Even their recruiter is having to write positive things about the company.  Next, they will have their Vice Presidents and Executive Directors writing positive reviews.  I would not put it past upper management to make it mandatory.

pros: Unique and forward thinking culture progam.  Would be amazing if the followed what the say.  Super fancy new corporate office with all the bells & whistles including private bathroom for CEO.
cons:
Repeatedly change policy & practice with out warning or consulting those who do the actual work.  New culture program created more resentment & dissatisfaction than it solves.  Tell us how bad multi-tasking is for your brain, cares, & accuracy.  Still expect you to multi-task.  Tells you to "own every problem".  Then punishes those who try to.  Says residents and employees are important then allowes corporate managers to mock & make fun of them and how "stupid" they are. 
Tells you to be sympathetic & understanding.  Then when you get outsourced ypu are told to act happy & get over it less than 24 hours later.

Not that any of that will matter for long since the goal seems to be to outsource everyone so vp's & upper management can go golfing & buy fancy pictures & go clubbing without having to deal with actual employee's.

review_title: Going down the tubes!  Poor corporate leadership.
job_title: Executive Director in Delray Beach, FL
pros: Serving the residents and serving the employees.  The culture is created at the community and preserved by the staff and resident relationships.
cons: Navigating the horrible corporate culture!  This company is going down the tubes and it won't belong before the Board of Directors intervenes.

pros: The  non-exempt people are awesome to work with!
cons: From the CEO down to Executive directors is another story. No Direction!!  Approvals from corporate office take way too long and lay on desks for no apparent reason. Makes dept. directors struggle with the day to day operation and respect of residents.   Bad decisions from Directors have lost a lot of good people, self included. Creation of a hostile workplace by management got me!

pros: The residents were a delight to work with. They were always happy to receive any help we could give them. The hourly employees are also terrific to work with.
cons: Some of the local managers are unresponsive and unhelpful. I think this is because corporate puts so much pressure on them, and treats them so badly that they in turn treat their employees badly. Moral is incredibly low.

pros: The management is very organized. The meals are included during work hours on lunch or dinner breaks. All of the staff are very friendly.
cons: Not many benefits for employees who are part time. Because there is a limited number of employees, finding someone to cover a shift can be difficult.

job_title: Spiritual Life Director in Delray Beach, FL
pros: Coworkers were supportive, very friendly, and willing to help you succeed as a team. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Able to work independently without micromanaging from management. They valued this position.
cons: Didn't have a full-time position for this job

pros:
Working for the wonderful residents which Lifespace seems to have forgotten are the customers and their source of income. 

Working with great coworkers which Lifespace has forgotten are the gears that makes everything work.

There are a lot of great programs Lifespace have but don't work because behind the scene Lifespace have ruined everything. Both residents and employees are too upset and angry for any of it to work.

Lifespace will most likely outsource you to another company that often pay better. Now think about that for a minute. You bring in a company to do things cheaper that pay their own employees better? That right there is a huge hint on what is wrong.

Profiting off of a non-profit organization.
cons:
15 years ago there was a 2 year waiting list for the Village on the Green, one of Lifespace's communities. That is how popular and wonderful the place was. Now there are 35 empty apartments out of 250. That is the worse it has ever been and the trend indicates it will only get worse. This means loss of income which in turn results in more services being cut which in turn upsets the customers who move out or bad mouth the company to their friends who should be potential customers. The typical strategy when you have a product that doesn't sell is to lower the price. Lifespace does the opposite and raises prices which causes more customers to move out.

The grounds crew, the security staff, and dietary management have all been outsourced within the last year. Hours for maintenance, housekeeping and dietary have been cut within the last month. The company calls these "cost cutting initiatives". It actually is a sign of a desperate company about to fail.

review_title: Can't get much worse??? Or can it?
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: The Residents are the most amazing people and they are loyal they love their team members and a few team members that remain are what is good that's all
cons: Blatant favoritism, verbally and mentally abusive environment. it is who you know at "Corporate " and not your qualifications and what you are capabilities. Executive Director is on drugs or acts like it, awful directors unqualified some without degrees and some are alcoholics everyone looks the other way - do as I say not as I do I suppose, don't get involved just do your job yeah that works. home office what a joke these people are unintelligent sinking us like the titanic, increased by 117% lining their pockets while no raises for us, laughing down at the Communities, spa days and lobster dinners while residents lose services great use of residents $. Go talk to HR yeah right they just go tell on you and you get in trouble. They treat team members "beneath" them like dog crap. Refuse to allow vacation earned vacation at that!! yet in same breath "promote a balanced work/home life" take time off you'll pay for it after with a Smerk on their face. Then they go take time off right after what a great feeling. expect to squeeze more out of people using scare tactics which results into the opposite - a horrible environment, don't you have common sense, promote a happy and healthy thriving environment and your "people" will produce and go above the norm. No feeling of job security quite the opposite. No trust in this company just stepping on people and reality tv drama shenanigans. Keep your head down there worker and get back to work. Embarrassed to work 4 such a despicable company. All about $$$ now. HO won't be happy until everyone leaves but then who will be in the communities. The residents and team members suffer daily and are mad as heck. Get told one thing one day then something opposite the next day and it's your fault you are confused! Massive confusion and no structure too much OCD control we are not children. When will the BOD step in and eliminate CEO and HO. It will be too late. Promote from within stop bringing on your prior buddies, this is real life maybe the members from within you already know will say no so you bring in the poor ignorant new people- they'll find out they always do. Only been here a few months and worst experience ever. Be human care about people - enough is enough. How many amazing people have to exit? Deaf ear every . "Everyone is replaceable" is this the new motto how is that living LIFESPACE?

pros: Great coworkers and residents redevelopment happening
